p: Seeds used as initial explants of Phyllantus amarus were subjected to asepsis with 70% alcohol for 30 s, followed by sodium hypochlorite solution (2.5% active chlorine) with two to three drops of Tween-20 for 20 min. Seeds were then immersed in sterile deionized water three consecutive times. After asepsis, they were germinated in MS medium [ 15] containing 1.5% sucrose and 0.8% agar, with pH adjusted to 5.8. Seeds were kept in a growth room with a 16 h photoperiod and approximately 20–25 μmol·m −2·s −1 photosynthetically active radiation provided by cold white fluorescent light, at 26 ± 1 °C, for a period of 10 weeks.
